intro: Urtica frutescens, commonly known as stinging nettle, is a flowering plant in the Urticaceae family. It is characterized by its hollow, hairless stems and heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges. The plant contains fine,螫性 (stinging) hairs that release an irritant when touched, causing a rash in humans. It thrives in moist, temperate environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Urtica frutescens is also valued for its nutritional content and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
